ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I would definitely recommend it. The course offers an in-depth analysis of the history and culture of Mesopotamia in the 2nd millennium BCE, and the problems inherent in this study.

Yes, this course is excellent for a graduate student of any level. The quality of the seminar depends greatly on how prepared the participants are with the readings, so if you're not willing to put in the work, please don't take the course.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: There's simply too much to say. As a scholar who intends to study this period, I found the course invaluable.
It was an excellent survey of 3rd, 2nd millenium Babylonian history, covering all the appropriate aspects: political, economic history, intellectual history, literature, etc.
